Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Direct diffusion through pores of MIL-88B(Fe)

Other Information.Additional Info: H2 permeability increased with MIL-88B(Fe) loading.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Hindered transport due to molecular sieving effect

Other Information.Additional Info: CH4 permeability decreased significantly after incorporation of MIL-88B(Fe).

Sieving Mechanism: Molecular sieving effect due to pore size between kinetic diameter of H2 and CH4

Experimental Validation.Method: Wicke–Kallenbach technique (single gas permeation and mixture gas separation experiments)
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: H2 permeability increased by 16%, H2–CH4 mixture separation factor increased by 66% at 10% MIL-88B(Fe) loading.

Other Information.Additional Info: Operation temperature has a positive effect on separation performance; higher temperature enhances H2 permeability and selectivity.
